CallStack

Serveur part data structure that is used to make call to services

Author:
T. Gautier

The Kaapi network communicate with active messages. The sender side first creates a new messsage (open, pack/put, close) and send it to the server part. The call stack structure holds the call of an active message into the server side. The call stack stores data and state of the incomming communications (error code, header, etc).

The call stack may be used to allocate small data structure required to stores other state of communications. 

    int* addr_in_stack = (int*)cs.allocate(sizeof(int));
    *addr_in_stack = 123;

The CallStack allows to unpack immediate data of the message by using 'unpack'. The public data member 'iov' contains at least the size of each iovect entry of the deferred data. Moreover it stores as public data member :

  • the error code of the receiving message,
  • a pointer to the header
  • a pointer to the extended header
  • a pointer to the iovect entries for DA data

The user could suspend the CallStack life cycle by acquiring a reference on it: it should free its reference in order to garbage collect the CallStack structure. This feature could be used in order to redirect a call to a service to other node. See ICS implantation.

void redo_allocate (void *start_inccstack, size_t size_ia, size_t size_da)

Friends

class CallStack

Detailed Description

Message definition as a sub part of a callstack. To distinguish data for a message with respect to data for all messages (a callstack), the Message sub class has been introduced.

size_t Net::CallStack::Message::get_da_iovector ( IOVectEntry *  iov,
size_t  count_iov 
)

Get the iovector that contain DA data of the message. The iov pointer should have been allocated by the caller. The number of iov entries to store the DA is the return value of the invocation. No more count_iov entries are setup. If more entries is necessary, then the return value is greather than count_iov.

Returns:
the number of ioventries to store IA data.
size_t Net::CallStack::Message::get_ia_iovector ( IOVectEntry *  iov,
size_t  count_iov 
)

Get the iovector that contain IA data of the message. The iov pointer should have been allocated by the caller. The number of iov entries to store the IA is the return value of the invocation. No more count_iov entries are setup. If more entries is necessary, then the return value is greather than count_iov.

Returns:
the number of ioventries to store IA data.
void Net::CallStack::Message::redo_allocate ( void *  start_inccstack,
size_t  size_ia,
size_t  size_da 
) [inline]

Redo bloc memory allocation of data already receive in the stack of the callback. The method allocates setup bloc entry for each destriptor depending of size_ia and size_da args. On return to this function the service could be call using unpack and get methods.

Parameters:
iov_read (in) the pointer to the first IOVectEntry, should be allocated
size_ia (in) the size in bytes of the immediate data to receive
size_da (in) the size in bytes of the difered data to receive
